title: Remembrance Sunday 2014 - as it happened | UK news | The Guardian

documents.title: summary
text: for some the duties continue .
prince charles is joining the welsh guards for lunch , as their colonel , and will then be laying a wreath at the guards ' memorial at wellington barracks .

we leave you now , with this link to some striking images from the imperial war museum , including a makeshift grave marked by a rough home made cross and a rifle shoved into the mud of the somme - a reminder of just what the world promised today it would never forget .
mk and ag .
battle of morval .
a makeshift grave in a shell-hole , marked by an inverted rifle driven into the ground near combles .
michael ball has just tweeted that he 's driving to aldershot for a remembrance day songs of praise .
michaelball ( @ mrmichaelball ) driving to aldershot for live remembrance day songs of praise .
the sun is shinning .
britain looks glorious .
such beauty amid such sorrow .
mk

most of those who spent long hours standing on cold pavements , around the country and in london have now scattered for a well earned lunch : every pub within striking distance of whitehall is now full .
here are some more photos from earlier : military personnel during the remembrance sunday service at the cenotaph memorial in bristol .
birchall/pa a man lays a wreath as veterans march past .
macgregor/reuters chelsea pensioners pay their respects during the 'march past ' .
jackson/getty images queen elizabeth ii observes a moment of silence at the cenotaph .
in background is prince william , the duke of cambridge .
rain/epa

documents.title: remembrance sunday video
text: here 's the guardian video summarising events on remembrance sunday : remembrance sunday : queen leads commemoration in london .
crowds are gathering at the tower of london .
here 's a vine from yole which shows people walking by the thames and over tower bridge : ag
remembrance sunday is commemorated up and down the country by communities .

here are a collection of tweets showing sone local services : shrewsbury urc ( @ shrewsburyurc ) we remembered those that gave the ultimate sacrifice during the first world war during todays service # poppies tracey leigh ( @ cockney gal ) islington remembrance day service @ twitterid @ twitterid1 travellingsimonphoto ( @ travellingsimon ) a great turnout for a moving remembrance day service in # macclesfield this morning # lestweforget # poppypride dclg ( @ communitiesuk ) today we are remembering the first muslim vc recipient from world war one , kudadad khan # vcpavingstones pmac ( @ phil mac9896 ) enough said glasgow rangers fc .
lest we forget .
hamst ( @ thehamst ) a veteran salutes at scunthorpe war memorial at today 's remembrance day service # remembrancesunday ag
more than 5,000 people turned out for the service at the national arboretum , more than twice the expected attendance and the largest for any event the memorial has held .
mk
many of the main ceremonies in commonwealth countries including canada and australia will follow on the actual armistice day , tuesday .
mk
at ide , a village near exeter , the rugby side only reformed this season after a 106 year gap , after it lost so many members in the great war .
today it played a remembrance day match wearing red poppies on the blue kit .
mk
the services held in afghanistan at kabul and kandahar this morning are likely to be the last involving british serving personnel .
remembrance poppies adorn uniforms as british troops and service personal remaining in afghanistan .
cardy/getty images the camp bastion base , in helmand province where so many of the 450 british casualties occurred over the last 13 years , is due to close in a few weeks .
the last troops should leave the country by the end of december .
british troops and service personal remaining in afghanistan .
cardy/getty images the ceremony at camp souter in kabul was attended by members of all three services and international representatives .
brigadier james stopford said after the service : this year is particularly poignant as we mark the centenary of the great war .

for those of us serving here in afghanistan on operations , we remember with enormous pride the terrible sacrifice by our uk armed forces colleagues and those of our coalition partners , and in particular the very brave members of the afghan security forces .
our shared sacrifice has made a significant difference to this country and ours and continues to do so - we will remember them . ''
at kandahar musicians from the royal artillery band played the last post , and wreaths were laid .
a piper plays as british troops and service personal remaining in afghanistan .
cardy/getty images mk
lorna hughes has vined from liverpool a march past st george 's hall , lime street
the royal british legion unveiled a sculpture , every man remembered , in trafalgar square last week .
the structure , a collaborative piece with artist mark humphrey , stands at 7.5 metres high and will form a focal point for remembrance until 16 november .
here 's a vine from fatima : ag
douglas carswell , who caused such political convulsions by resigning as tory mp and then winning clacton for ukip , tweets that the service was bigger than ever there .
since he remains the sole ukip mp his party leader , nigel farage , was not invited to join the other leaders at the cenotaph - to his outrage .
douglas carswell mp ( @ douglascarswell ) # clacton remembrance service bigger than ever .
a couple of thousand folk turned out , i 'd reckon mk

from the medals of a great grandfather to the allotment at the tower of london : here 's a collection of remembrance day tweets : ag liz devine ( @ lizdevine5 ) tower of london moat during the first world war , growing vegetables not poppies .

lynsey manley ( @ manleylynsey ) great grandad 's first world war medals # remembranceday ✿ gem ✿ ( @ gembarry ) rip to my great great great uncle charlie who died in the first world war in the battle of somme � we will remember them � wigantoday ( @ wigtoday ) this tribute was left for robert reid , the first soldier to die in world war one lucy hibbitt-morris ( @ lucyhibitt ) my great great granddad was on the frontline in the first world war .
it makes me so proud , r.i.p to all the fallen soldiers # lestweforget ❤️
as a carpet of crimson now lies before the cenotaph , dimbleby describes the casualties of the first world war , military and civilian , as unparalleled carnage '' .
back at whitehall , the shot at dawn association , who campaigned for pardons for those shot for desertion , and won in 2006 , now march past .
mk
dan jarvis , the former army officer turned labour mp .

party/pa dan jarvis , a soldier until four years ago when he became mp for barnsley central and shadow justice minister , writes of the eerie experience of seeing his own name on the memorial of the missing at thiepval : earlier this year i travelled to the somme in northern france to pay my respects to those soldiers who came from barnsley and lost their lives during the first world war .
i stood in the trenches they had defended .
i imagined the terror they must have experienced .
the piercing shrill of the whistle signalling the advance and the order to go 'over the top ' .
i walked the ground over which they had fought .
open rolling countryside that has changed little over the past century .
i knelt in front of their graves .
it felt like they were a long way from home .
whilst there i visited the memorial of the missing at thiepval .
and it was there , as i read the names inscribed on the memorial , that i saw my own name staring back at me - d. jarvis .
it was a very moving experience . ''
in wales 10,000 wooden crosses now ring cardiff castle .
welsh secretary stephen crabb has laid a wreath at the wales national war memorial in cathays park : 40,000 welsh died in the great war .

carl adamson , from llandudno , travelled to join the london march : he needed 14 operations to reconstruct his face , and was blinded in the last week of his service in northern ireland with the cheshire regiment .
football clubs across the country have led memorial services .

west ham united tweets its promise to remember : west ham united fc ( @ whufc official ) remembrance sunday : we will remember them mayor of newham sir robin wales , west ham united joint-chairman david gold and aston villa chief executive tom fox observe a remembrance sunday silence alongside west ham players before the match .

lee/getty images chelsea pensioners received cheers during the service at the cenotaph : chelsea pensioner harry puttick , 85 , and marjorie cole , 70 , two of the 18 residents of chelsea 's royal hospital , which houses retired members of the army , took part in first world war commemorations at the royal albert hall on saturday .
jamieson/pa

memorials all over the country list the names of the dead , but one small parish council , shepreth in cambridgeshire , is putting up a board to remember and rejoice in the 30 who went to the great war and came home safely .
the 10 who died are already commemorated in the village .
while in eastbourne , east sussex , there is bitterness at the theft of two poppy collection tins , heavy with donations , from the counters of local shops .
mk
unseen by the cameras , one of the young choir boys collapsed during the ceremony : medics rushed to take care of him and he was led away through the crowd .
like many of the other participants he will have been up since dawn or before .
mk
it was n't just human beings who suffered : the national pigeon corps passes - the little feathery messengers played an important role a century ago .

alex salmond recalls scotland 's role : scotland , in common with so many other nations , suffered an appalling loss of life in the great war , and its effects on scottish life were profound and long-lasting .
not one single community was untouched by the conflict , and rural scotland suffered particularly severe losses . ''

captain dave henson , who is attending the ceremony for the first time , comments to sophie raworth from the bbc on something that surprises many at their first remembrance day : that after the solemnity and tears , of the silence and the prayers , the street changes and becomes surprisingly jaunty .
the mood lifts into celebration '' , he notes .
mk
from earlier , the queen lays a wreath at the cenotaph : britain 's queen elizabeth ii lays a wreath at the cenotaph on remembrance sunday in london .
rain/epa
out of sight of the cameras , the front of the procession is passing the duke of york taking the salute on horse guards parade with the defence secretary , michael fallon .
mk
the official british army twitter account tweets this collection of photos : british army ( @ britisharmy ) when you go home , tell them of us and say , for your tomorrow , we gave our today .
# remberancesunday # lestweforget
the war widows association , who won a legal victory 48 hours ago in keeping their pensions if they remarry or form new partnerships , bring their wreath .
mk
the falklands veterans pass now .

the servicemen from the wheelchair sports association whizz past - no motorised transport for them - a young boy in a replica first world war uniform , wearing his father 's service medals , salutes as he passes .
mk
as ever the procession passes at a brisk march - the whole street is now singing it 's a long way to tipperary .
the british limbless ex-serviceman 's association - which includes many who took part in the recent invictus games - pass in invalid scooters polished to a brilliant gleam .
the magnificently scarlet chelsea pensioners as ever get one of the biggest cheers .
jonathan freedland writes : the silence itself was especially intense on whitehall : the centre of one of the busiest cities in the world brought to a still hush .
you could see the traffic lights changing , but there were no cars to heed them .
for 120 seconds , the air was filled not with noise but the quiet of thousands of private thoughts .
crowds gather for the annual remembrance sunday service at the cenotaph .
jackson/getty images
only a decade ago there were veterans of the first world war in the procession .

this year the march past is led by ten veterans of the second world war normandy landings : the normandy association is now disbanding after this year , though all the veterans who are still able pledge to return regularly to services at the beaches where they landed under a blizzard of fire .
mk
the space around the cenotaph is now being cleared , the barriers removed and the bands marching off , to make space for the march past the monument by thousands of veterans and relatives .

down the road the service at westminster abbey at which many more wreaths were laid , is just endingscottish secretary alistair carmichael , and first minister alex salmond have been attending a service at st giles 's cathedral in edinburgh .
mk
the guardian 's jonathan freedland has sent this dispatch from the service : the royals and political leaders have gone back inside , into thewarmth of the foreign office .
a curious custom this : it means they arenot there to see the parade of the veterans themselves .
leading it this year will be the normandy veterans association , in honour of the 70th anniversary of the d-day landings .
they 've been standing ready , in the same position , on a fairly chilly morning , for at least anhour .
but , as we all know , they 've endured much worse . ''
the president of the royal british legion lays his wreath .

dimbleby reminds us that the largest ex-serviceman 's association - which raised £ 39m from the poppy appeal last year and hopes to top that this year - was the inspiration of a wounded soldier , invalided out of the first world war in 1916 and was appalled at how little was being done for his comrades .
ceramic poppies that form part of the art installation blood swept lands and seas of red '' at the tower of london in london .
melville/reuters
the politicians march back in .

the solemn moments apart from the normal flurry of the city may have been a few welcome moments of peace for ed milliband , since the other story of the day is the backbench and labour voter heave against his leadership .
mk
an aerial view on the cenotaph from earlier : the queen leading the service .
ag an aerial view on the cenotaph : queen elizabeth ii leading the remembrance sunday service at the cenotaph in central london .
pete mobbs / british ministry of defence / handout/epa
applause - strictly a breach of former protocol - as the queen leads the procession back into the foreign office .
many will have long hours of further official duties to come .
mk
the foot guards take up the national anthem , with the entire street joining in - only one verse , so no risk of anyone forgetting the words .
the lord 's prayer , with its promise to forgive the trespassers , in hope of forgiveness ourselves .
the sweet voices of the chapel royal children rise effortlessly above the sound of the band , as the dignitaries and crowds on the pavement join in singing o god our help in ages past .
mk
the bishop of london , richard chartres , looking as ever like a figure stepped from the pages of hilary mantel 's tudor novels , leads the prayers .
daniel mulhall , the first irish ambassador invited to lay a wreath , adds his in memory of thousands of irish who also died .
the chiefs of the army , navy and air forces follow , and then the representatives of the services whose role was equally vital , the merchant navy and fishing fleet .
mk
my colleague caroline davies tweets : caroline davies ( @ ccdavies ) duchesses of cornwall and cambridge watch from balcony at fco building .
both in black .
catherine , duchess of cambridge , camilla , duchess of cornwall , and sophie , countess of wessex attend the annual remembrance sunday service at the cenotaph on whitehall .
jackson/getty images
a spectacularly colourful wreath made by the staff at kew gardens is laid by the foreign secretary , philip hammond , on behalf of the commonwealth .
the commonwealth high commissioners , whose countries including australia and new zealand , jamaica , and kenya , also suffered atrocious losses in the first world war , follow .
their wreaths , beginning to carpet the steps of the monument , are a reminder of just how much of the globe was caught up in the terror of a century ago .

documents.title: politicians lay wreaths
text: david cameron lays his wreath - his coat , less beautifully cut than the military uniforms , needs to be tugged into place as he rises .
nick clegg , deputy prime minster comes next , followed by the leader of the opposition , ed miliband , who bows his head for a moment longer than the others .
the solemn moment must be a rare few seconds of peace for him .
mk prime minister david cameron with john major ( l ) attend the annual remembrance sunday service at the cenotaph on whitehall .
jackson/getty images chancellor of the exchequer george osborne , labour leader ed miliband , tony blair and deputy prime minister , nick clegg attend the annual remembrance sunday service .
jackson/getty images
the duke of kent , whose father died in a flying accident when he was six , lays the last of the royal wreaths .

his eldest son , charles , lays his wreath next , ornamented with prince of wales feathers , and his son , who served for more than seven years in the forces , and is now an air ambulance helicopter pilot , follows kate and camilla watch from a balcony above .

documents.title: queen lays wreath
text: the queen lays her wreath on the top step of the cenotaph , on behalf of the whole country .
the duke of edinburgh , whose health has caused concern in his 93rd year , lays the second wreath , unwaveringly straight backed .
queen elizabeth ii attends the annual remembrance sunday service .
jackson/getty images
the queen , head slightly bowed , is wearing a cluster of four poppies held in place with a diamond brooch .
the two minute silence ends with another shell from the gun and the last post .

documents.title: two minutes silence
text: with the first deep stroke of big ben , and the echoing boom of the field gun , the two minute silence begins .
the queen leads her family members to the north side of the cenotaph , just in time for the silence .
roman catholic , jewish , muslim , hindu , baptist , sikh , and many other religious leaders take their place .
the irish ambassador emerges with a plain green wreath of laurel leaves .
the party leaders are now emerging to take their places .
the children of the chapel royal , in some of the most beautiful uniforms of the day , follow their cross bearer out from the foreign office .

dr richard chartres , bishop of london , follows the cross bearer harry bradford , a former child of the chapel royal himself , who sang at the memorial service for princess diana at wellington barracks in 2007 .
mk
followed , in case there 's any throat without a lump , purcell 's when i am laid in earth , from the band of the foot guards .
mk
another piece which always sparks discreet dabbing away of tears : elgar 's nimrod .
mk

here are photos from events in whitehall , from assembled veterans to members of the public : ag veterans assemble for the annual remembrance sunday service at the cenotaph on whitehall on november 9 , 2014 in london , united kingdom .
jackson/getty images a modern commemoration : a member of the public takes a on her tablet .
jackson/getty images members of the armed forces attend the annual remembrance sunday service at the cenotaph .
jackson/getty images ceramic poppies are seen at an art installation , on remembrance sunday , at the tower of london november 9 , 2014 .
hall/reuters
the pipe band on whitehall plays the heartbreaking lament the flowers of the forest , written for those who died in a war long ago , flodden in 1513 .
mk

the deputy governor of the tower john brown says the emotional response to the poppies has been extraordinary - and reminds us that for another three nights , at dusk , 180 names will be read out of the real people represented by the ceramic flowers , as they have been every night since the installation began .
mk

our ireland correspondent henry mcdonald has sent this dispatch : for the first time since 1946 , ireland 's ambassador to the uk will lay a wreath at the cenotaph in whitehall.in a move symbolising ever improving anglo-irish relations , ambassador dan mulhall will attend the ceremony within the hour.the british government made the invitation last month to mark the immense contribution and shared sacrifice '' of thousands of irish people who served in british forces .

in the first world war alone more than 50,000 irishmen were killed.up until very recently the irish state did not take part officially in remembrance sunday commemorations either in britain or ireland .

during world war two what was then the irish free state remained neutral in the struggle against nazi germany.in another highly symbolic moment , taoiseach ( prime minister ) enda kenny will today attend the poppy day service in enniskillen at the very site back in 1987 when a provisional ira bomb killed eleven local protestants gathered around the co.fermanagh town 's cenotaph .
kenny 's foreign minister meanwhile , charlie flanagan , will represent the irish republic at the cenotaph at belfast city hall this morning .

flanaga described it as a significant development , which provides a chance for further reconciliation , to reflect on moments of shared and divided history , and to remember all those who lost their lives in the conflict.to mark world war one 's centenary a special religious service will also be held at st.patrick 's cathedral in dublin later today .
it is estimated that more than 100,000 irishmen served in the army , navy and air force for britain during the first world war .
the service will be broadcast live across ireland on rte .
st.patrick 's has held a poppy day commemoration since 1919 although again until relatively recently no irish state dignatories took part .
during her historic visit to ireland in 2011 the queen laid a wreath in honour of those who fought for irish independence at dublin 's garden of remembrance .

in a parallel move , ireland 's president michael d higgins joined northern ireland secretary theresa villiers and the duke of kent at a commemoration for the war dead who fought for britain at service in dublin 's glasnevin cemetery earlier this year .
all three dedicated a new cross erected to those irish people who died in world war one .

the hollow square '' of uniforms is forming around the cenotaph : the blues and royals , the welsh guards , the navy , the raf , and 180 uniformed civilians , members of the police , fire service , prison officers and other services .
mk

the first truly world war left memorials in so many countries : us ambassador to kenya bob godec tweets that he has been at a ceremony at the commonwealth cemetery in nairobi : ambassador bob godec ( @ bobgodec ) attended remembrance day memorial service @ commonwealth cemetery in nairobi .
we will always remember and honor their service and sacrifice .
mk
1 has just gone live to whitehall - the unmistakable voice of david dimbleby , with jaunty military band marches in the background .
dimbleby says he never remembers such large crowds as for this centenary ceremony .
mk
after the two minutes silence at 11am , wreaths are laid by dignitaries at the cenotaph , which the queen leads .
other members of the royal family and then parliamentary leaders will follow .
here are archive photos from previous decades : from the 1970 archives : the queen lays a wreath on the cenotaph in whitehall on remembrance sunday .

/pa archive/press association ima on remembrance day 1985 , cenotaph scenes : queen elizabeth ii prince philip and prince michael of kent walk past david steel neil kinnock and baroness margaret thatcher .
cross/associated newspa/rex the queen , the duke of kent , prince philip and prince charles at the service in 1993 .
jorgensen/rex queen elizabeth ii , the duke of edinburgh ( dark uniform ) and the duke of gloucester ( light uniform ) , take part in the remembrance day service at the cenotaph , during the 1950s .
/pa archive/press association ima

our correspondent on the ground caroline davies has tweeted about the visible security : caroline davies ( @ ccdavies ) sniffer dogs are now being walked up whitehall as part of the tight security around the cenotaph .
armed police also very visible .

twitter is filling up with images of the tower poppies , and accounts of myriad local ceremonies where the emotions are as intensely felt as the big event at the cenotaph : here 's banbury mk banbury town council ( @ townevents ) 5 minutes until the 2014 remembrance day parade
the guardian 's jonathan freedland is watching events unfold on whitehall .
he writes : among the crowds on whitehall , poppies on every lapel .
spotted so far , a line of green-blazered veterans of the royal ulster constabulary .
but most in the crowd - six-deep in the prime position by the cenotaph - seem to have little direct connection to the military other than a desire to show respect .
there 's a respectful hush , even now . ''
the chief of the defence staff general sir nick houghton has been speaking on the bbc 's andrew marr show .

our chief political correspondent nicholas watt reports : the chief of the defence staff has pledged to fix his bayonet and fight to the last '' to protect the british army from further cuts if the government presses ahead with further spending reductions after the general election .
general sir nick houghton , the chief of the defence staff , said he likes to work within the system .
but he told the andrew marr show on bbc1 : i think we are good value for money and i will , quietly within the system , fix my bayonet and fight to the last . ''

houghton said that the overall numbers of the army are not in as good a position '' as he had hoped after the government decided to cut the number if regular forces to just over 80,000 while boosting the number of reserve forces to 30,000 by 2018 .
there have been some early glitches in that campaign to recruit those , '' he said .

houghton , who was appearing before travelling to the remembrance sunday service in whitehall , challenged the traditional view of the first world war that british troops had been lions led by donkeys .
this was the phrase associated with the book , the donkeys , on the the western front offensives in 1915 by the late tory mp and historian alan clark .
houghton said : certainly there has been an attempt to caricature the stupidity of leadership and the huge courage of the lions .
this does a massive disservice because it takes the actions of that time out of context .
it applies a post facto rationale borne of many decades that have gone since .
it is military caricature , it is hobbyist history to make money not to do justice to people in their time . ''
some british service personnel remain in afghanistan and soldiers have attended a service at the kandahar airbase .
mk
the national memorial arboretum reports that 1,500 people have already arrived , and they 're expecting at least 2000 by 11am .
mk

irish politicians are heading to ceremonies north of the border - a move which would have been unthinkable even 20 years ago - led by taoiseach enda kenny who will again be in enniskillen , scene of the remembrance day atrocity in 1987 .
mk
our colleague caroline davies is tweeting live from the cenotaph .
here is a round-up of what she 's seen so far : caroline davies ( @ ccdavies ) royal british legion say 10,000 will march past cenotaph today .
mostly ex servicemen and women and 1,500 civilians .
caroline davies ( @ ccdavies ) 200,000 irishmen volunteered for british army in ww1 and at least 35,000 were killed .
caroline davies ( @ ccdavies ) remembrance ceremony particularly poignant this year .
marks 100 years since start of ww1 and 70 years since d-day .
dave henson , gold medal winner and captain of the british invictus games team who lost both legs when he stepped on a bomb in afghanistan , is joining the bbc commentary team .
as usual he 's wearing shorts over his artificial legs : they 're more comfortable and i 'm rather proud of them , '' he said cheerfully .
mk
back to events in london , there is a clatter of helicopters already over whitehall as the street fills - the places closest to the cenotaph are long gone .
mk
the royal british legion have produced this video , live on , to commemorate the memory of the fallen and the future of the living : ag
leo benedictus has written a feature on how the first world war centenary has bought about a revival in memorial restorations .

he writes : the amount of grants provided by the war memorials trust for the restoration of memorials has reached £ 140,027 so far this year - 31 % higher than last year when a record £ 106,017 was allocated . ''
ag
commentator kevin mckenna has written for the observer and explains why he still wears his poppy despite the naysayers .
in the piece he writes : i have been wearing the poppy , not with any sense of pride but with a sense of deep , deep humility .
who cares whether i do or not ?
possibly , just possibly , a mother still mourning her dead son in iraq or an old woman who still remembers the father she waved off to war in 1942 . ''
ag

the telegraph reports that security at whitehall - always ubiquitous on the day as anyone who glances up at the dark figures keeping watch from the skyline will note - will be tightened around the royal party in the wake of reported terrorist plots .
mk
the guardian has created a global guide to the first world war in an interactive documentary , featuring ten historians from 10 countries and is translated into multiple languages .
you can view it here : ag

prime minister david cameron , deputy prime minster nick clegg and leader of the labour party ed miliband have tweeted about remembrance sunday this morning : ag david cameron ( @ david cameron ) today , in the 100th anniversary year of the outbreak of ww1 , we remember those who gave their lives so we can live in freedom .
# lestweforget nick clegg ( @ nick clegg ) ed miliband ( @ ed miliband ) to those who laid down their lives for britain : the country will always remember your service and your sacrifice .
prime minister david cameron has paid tribute to the armed forces , and the 453 who died in afghanistan , in what he described as a year of poignant milestones .
mk
crowds gathered at dawn at the tower of london to view the tide of ceramic poppies now flooding the moat , already seen by an estimated 4m people .

although volunteers will begin dismantling it on wednesday , there was jubilation over the news that part of the installation will remain until the end of the month , and some elements of it will be preserved permanently at the imperial war museum .
mk general view of the tower of london 's blood swept lands and seas of red installation , london .
devlin/pa archive/press association images

at 11am this morning , on the first stroke of big ben , the deep boom of a first world war field gun will echo through whitehall , and the heart of a great city will fall silent , an event so unusual that it is invariably a slightly eerie experience , when a single cough in the street or a seagull 's cry overhead can sound as shockingly loud as the inevitable distant siren 's wail .

this year the ceremony , echoed at thousands of war memorials and churches across the country and overseas , carries an extra freight of emotion , marking the the centenary of the outbreak of the first world war.long before the live television coverage begins at10.30 am , whitehall will be full , with crowds ten deep on the pavements nearest the cenotaph .
myself and aisha gani will be following the events of the day in britain and overseas , with the help of colleagues already in place in whitehall .
at least 10,000 people are expected to march past the cenotaph after the official wreath laying , taking adding their own poppy tributes until the monument is surrounded by a carpet of scarlet .
there are no more veterans of the first world war , and the ranks of the second world war veterans grow thinner every year .

as well as the official events in churches and at war memorials , the day will be marked by a ceremony at the national arboretum , where the armed forces memorial is inscribed with the 16,000 names who have died on duty or as a result of terrorism since the end of the second world war in 1948 .
when the monument was created , blank space was left on the portland stone walls , which has been needed as more names are added every year .
mk

bulletin.text: The Queen leads the commemorations of the 100th anniversary of the beginning of the first world war with a two-minute silence at the Cenotaph in London today, with ceremonies and events around the country.
